website_summaries.verdict: These markers have a low odor and comfortable design, as well as a gauge on the side to track ink usage.
pros: Easy to erase, with no streaks
Vibrant colors, with chisel tips for thin or thick lines
Made with a patented 3-chamber ink system
cons: Caps are an odd shape that make it more difficult to store them in holders
Some claimed the colors were watery and tend to blot or bleed when using the markers

customer_reviews.title: Way better than Expos
customer_reviews.text: These markers are the best. They are highly pigmented (even the orange is legible from the back row!) and erase cleanly. I teach high school and will NEVER go back to Expo markers! Also, I love that they're impossible to stack when the caps are on (unlike other marker brands, the lid turns upside down to stick on the end), so you won't have kids sticking them all together in your marker tray or trying to make lightsabers out of them when there's a substitute teacher in your classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Does not have Bold Color compared to their other product "EnduraGlide, Fine Tip"
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, since it's no where near the quality of their other product "EnduraGlide, Fine Tip". Bold Color is not something you will get. See image. Honestly the image doesn't do it justice, as I believe it did some filtering to get the colors to show in view. In reality, the last line in Lime Green is about 1/5th as bold as it needs to be. It looks like the marker is actually near dead, beyond when you would throw it out. NOTE that I am comparing two products from the same company. Purchase this instead: Quartet Dry Erase Markers, EnduraGlide, Fine Tip, BOLD COLOR, Assorted COLOR, 4 Pack (5001-17M)
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: A decent alternative.
customer_reviews.text: Even my students commented how they like using these markers, very fluid/smooth to use. The downsides are they don’t last as long (I teach 5 periods of math daily, so a lot of writing; so 1 marker gets me just ~3 days) and the light green is too light to be seen from across the room. Also, quite a few times when I put the cap on the rear, pulling it off also pulls off the rear cap. For courses where you don’t have to write a lot on the board, I easily recommend them. For math/heavy usage, only if on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Nick M.

customer_reviews.title: Best markers for teaching
customer_reviews.text: These are literally the best markers I have ever used. The colors are bold (even the lighter shades), the ink is smooth, and they last the whole year--what's not to like? The anti-roll caps are wonderful, too, if you're like me and tend to walk away from the whiteboard before setting the marker down on a desk. The ink erases easily and doesn't smear like some others. I'm on my second pack of these and love them!
customer_reviews.author: AnotherOne

customer_reviews.title: Great for teachers!
customer_reviews.text: These are far superior to Expo markers. The color is richer, it goes on the board smooth, and doesn't dry out as fast. It seems when I open an Expo pack that a few are dry right from the box. It's annoying to have to run out of marker ink right in the middle of a lesson. I haven't had that problem with these markers yet.
customer_reviews.author: D. Phelan

customer_reviews.title: Dry.
customer_reviews.text: I had to shake mine multiple times to get a nice thick color and then it would just go back to what can only be described as an old man crossing the street with asthma. It erases fine. No good not terrible. You know when you write with a pen that's almost out of ink? That's how every single one of these was.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Amazing markers - not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I love these markers. They write smoothly, clear, and the resivoir lets you know when you've been working too hard. I've apparently been working to hard because in less than 2 weeks, I've already gone through the entire box of 12. I'm not sure about this enduraglide business. Now. Do take my review with a grain of salt. My classroom only has whiteboards to present materials and I teach 6 -55min classes bell to bell most days. I think I actually did alright with 2 weeks and 12 markers! :)
customer_reviews.author: Jakathera

customer_reviews.title: I won’t buy them again
customer_reviews.text: Broke bedore I could try it. Pulled the top off and this is what happened. The return process is even worse. It just goves you a number to call.
customer_reviews.author: DanyNap888

customer_reviews.title: Bold and fine, good value
customer_reviews.text: Several pretty colors. They're comfortable to use and work very well. I have ordered pens similar to these and I've been able to use them for a couple of weeks and before I know it, they're all dried up. These markers are very moist. I am sure they're going to last me a long while. They're not only good for making bold marks but you can use the chiselled side to write notes on your board. They are a good value for the money. I would definitely recommend these to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Boxiebabe

customer_reviews.title: Best markers, deepest color, but these.
customer_reviews.text: Best whiteboard markers. Great color, better than expo. I go through 10-20 markers a year, and these are the best so far.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good Markers but....
customer_reviews.text: The color variety pack means you end up getting some colors that are are to see and read when used on a board. This means they’re pretty much useless. I bought these for my wife to use for her dissertation and we only mainly use the black blue and red since they show up fine compared to the others.
customer_reviews.author: ' != true;

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these markers because I purchased them before and they were wonderful. However, the markers that I received are dried up. When I use them, the line is more faint than then line I can still draw with the old markers. I wish I could return them, but the package has been opened.
customer_reviews.author: Olga Amuzinskaya

customer_reviews.title: Vibrant and long lasting!
customer_reviews.text: These markers are FANTASTIC. I love the vibrant colors and they last a very long time! I go through EXPO and Sharpie makers like they're NOTHING. They dry out so quickly and easily. These on the other hand...I accidentally left one uncapped overnight and when I got to work the next morning IT STILL WORKED PERFECTLY. I loveeee them.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Harmon

customer_reviews.title: QUARTET YES....EXPO NO!
customer_reviews.text: Quartet dry erase markers show up WAY better! The Quartet markers put the Expo to shame! I have to write on a dry erase board daily and I like to make it colorful, I bought the Expo markers thinking that was going to happen. I was wrong...the colors barely showed up. So I bought a set of Quartet markers and HOLY JEBUS!
customer_reviews.author: Lauralye

customer_reviews.title: Over priced, but good dry erase markers...
customer_reviews.text: Not always a consistent discharge of color, but over all good dry erase markers. They erase well, only a smidgen of trace left, but with some elbow grease comes off. Colors are accurate, bright, bold and good color selection. Only thing missing was a magnet, but I hot glued a magnet to each for fridge use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris & Sum

customer_reviews.title: Best dry-erase markers!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best dry-erase markers. I had bought some a few years ago at a brick-and-mortar store, and almost all of them lasted this long. I left them behind for a coworker when I moved and could no longer find them at the office supply store. So thankful to find them on Amazon. These colors are far more vibrant than Expo and the tips stay crisp. You can do a thin or thick line with the chisel tip. As vibrant as the colors are, they erase easily (The dark blue can be stubborn if you leave it on too long, depending on your surface.) Excellent markers!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy H

customer_reviews.title: Faded
customer_reviews.text: The issue for me wasn't anything retailer-related. It arrived quickly, in perfect condition. My issue is with the product it's self. The ads all say this marker has great color with even lines and no lightening over time. I use them constantly at work and even with the 3 chamber pressure system they still lighten over time. Sad. I was looking forward with high hopes for these!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Horrible - DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: These are defective....they write a light grey...NOT BOLD BLACK AT ALL. Amazon told me to contact the manufacturer ACCO, which I did and they told me they are not responsible for replacing the defective item that Amazon is. I called Amazon back and because I am a Prime member they did offer replacement or refund. If I could give this a negative star, I would. Horrible product and HORRIBLE manufacturer. Don't buy - you will waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than most markers out there but still needs improvement.
customer_reviews.text: The color are very vibrant when you first start using the markers. There is no funky odor and it doesn't stain my ceramic white board. But at the halfway mark the markers don't perform as well anymore. The lines are fainter. Which makes it frustrating to use the marker at all at that point even though there is still quite a bit of ink left. And I noticed these didn't last very long either (or maybe I just used them excessively in a short period of time...)
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Bright, Bold, and Easy to Erase!
customer_reviews.text: I have the hardest time getting Expo markers to come off my board. And, Expo markers are highly disappointing because after a day or two of use, they fade and are impossible to be seen. Furthermore, Expo bright colors (like green, orange, bright blue) are impossible to be seen even when the markers are straight out of the package! However, these Quartet markers far surpassed my expectations! The colors are BOLD, BRIGHT!, and exceptionally easy to erase, even after being on my board for a few hours. I am a permanent fan of these markers, and will be buying them again and again!
customer_reviews.author: A. Villalobos

customer_reviews.title: Runs out fast
customer_reviews.text: If you're doing any extended writing with these, they won't last very long. I use these for scoring dart league matches and one marker lasted for two full team matches. I expected a bit more write time than that. Most of the colors are nice and bold but the ink tends to run a little.
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: while the other major brand still works fine. Disappointed that the markers decrease with time rather ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well intially, but after summer break in a box with the tops tightly closed, the markers are too faint to use, while the other major brand still works fine. Disappointed that the markers decrease with time rather than usage. I need markers that can sit over a vacation and not lose their ability to write!
customer_reviews.author: T. Clarkson

customer_reviews.title: Not As Vibrant As Expo Markers
customer_reviews.text: Not as vibrant as expo markers and twice as expensive. I was really excited about the color choices, but I wish it was more bold. Everything seems to work great, though so I don’t mind too much.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Lasts longer and cleans better
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy Expo, by became fed up when I would get markers that were dry before I used them...so I researched their #1 competitor, which is Quartet. An Expo box of 12 markers would last me 4-5 months. A Quartet box of 12 lasts me 7 months even though I am now teaching more classes than before. Quartet also cleans much easier. I'm not going back. Quartet is simply a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Pscolka

customer_reviews.title: 10-15% of these markers didn't work
customer_reviews.text: The markers that work are great, but they don't last forever. That's just what you can expect with paint dry erase. I own a quartet glass board, and these actually are the best markers for the board. I just can't figure out with 10-15% inside of the box weren't good markers.
customer_reviews.author: warriors fan

customer_reviews.title: The best for real!
customer_reviews.text: I discover this markers after a research of the best dry erase market; yes.. I did a research ... so I found them here in amazon and did my purchase. They are the best dryer ease markers I’ve used by now, strongly recommended if you like to use the glass/white board a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro M.

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Whiteboard Markers!
customer_reviews.text: These make Middle School math more engaging!! The chisel tip makes it easy to write on the whiteboard and the colors are super vibrant. I have to be honest and say that I am using them less often because I am going through the ink pretty fast! It can also be a bit challenging to erase. I usually have to use the Expo whiteboard cleaners about once a week to get rid of the residue.. But overall these are great whiteboard markers! I have been calling them my Magical Markers with my 8th graders and then I realized I needed to stop lol!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C

customer_reviews.title: Even worse than Expo, translucent on glass, hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: The Quartet’s pigment is translucent on glass board, not for glass board. Comparing to Expo, it is just as light if not lighter, and three times more difficult to erase after dried.
customer_reviews.author: Y.Z.

customer_reviews.title: Ink runs out quick
customer_reviews.text: I recently got a new whiteboard in my classroom. I was hoping this would be better than the normal expo markers I used since it looks bigger and thicker. It’s good but, the ink runs out too quickly.

customer_reviews.title: These Markers write more easily and wipe off more cleanly than the other "leading" ...
customer_reviews.text: These Markers write more easily and wipe off more cleanly than the other "leading" brand. They also don't have anywhere near the stink that the other markers do. I use them nearly everyday. The office manager ordered the other brand when these ran out and I respectfully asked that they be returned. The rest of the staff agreed that these markers were a huge improvement especially during long brainstorming sessions where they seem to help keep our hands from getting tired.
customer_reviews.author: F350 7.3

customer_reviews.title: Way better than Expo
customer_reviews.text: These markers last longer and write better than expo markers. The colors show up well and erase better as well. (From a teacher)
customer_reviews.author: T. Vemmer

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent quality
customer_reviews.text: While my package may not represent the whole, there is inconsistent quality in my batch. Orange and blue are sharp and as expected. Gray and green are dull making them hard to see for my students. Haven't looked into a return because I'm trying to not be too picky, but these are average dry erase markers at best.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rozell

customer_reviews.title: I think my students like these as much as I do
customer_reviews.text: I think my students like these as much as I do. Always writing in black or blue gets pretty boring. I particularly find reasons to incorporate the purple, aqua and teal. Since I teach Cardiopulmonary Science, these colors give me the opportunity to pick out points on an illustration or to accentuate sub-headings in the topics we are covering. Despite using PowerPoint I still find myself a heavy white board user which also makes me aware of the "flow" of how markers write, and just as importantly, how easily they erase. These are just great on all those points.
customer_reviews.author: RSD48

customer_reviews.title: Best Markers on the Market!
customer_reviews.text: If you want the best white board markers-- these Quartet markers are it! Vibrant colors, smooth writing, clean wipe off, and the ability to see the amount of ink left makes these markers the winners over every other brand I have used. With some cheapo white boards that I have for personal use, the ink doesn't stick like other white board markers. After sitting for 2 weeks, I had to wash the ink off with the old markers and scrub pretty hard; but with the Quartet after two weeks, the ink just comes right off with minimal effort. I highly suggest getting these.
customer_reviews.author: DIYEngineering

customer_reviews.title: Leaves behind
customer_reviews.text: Loved the boldness of the colors and the color choices. However, unless it’s the black or red, it smears on the whiteboard and some of it stays behind even after using the whiteboard cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Bright and the ink lasts!
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely the best whiteboard markers we've found so far. I homeschool my son, so we use the markers write often for math and some biology diagrams. They stray dark the entire time you're using them and the ink in just one black market (the one we use most often) has lasted two months.
customer_reviews.author: June Bug

customer_reviews.title: Colorful, pretty in the package, but not so great!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been using these pens very long, but I am not impressed. I like a softer tip that really does glide. I didn't find that here. As far as being able to see how much ink is left, this is not a big deal. Who has time to be doing that! I teach an adult foreign language class, and use dry-erase pens a good deal. I thought I was finding something new and perhaps better than other dry-erase pens, but I was mistaken. I suppose these tips will soften up with use, but I suspect there won't be much ink left by that time.
customer_reviews.author: Medarisa

customer_reviews.title: They just don’t last
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for white boarding for med school. I ran through a pack after a short period of time. The color is nice but they just have a short life span. Honestly, I would rather have bought many of the cheaper brands than 1 pack of these.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expo!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a teacher for 14 years, and these are great. Much better than the standard Expo. Plus they can’t be all put together into a huge chain, which becomes annoying with a class of students. If I ever get that again...
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as Expo brand markers
customer_reviews.text: Simply a bad product. I purchased one of their glass whiteboards so I thought I would purchase a matching set of markers. They are terrible compared to traditional Expo brand markers. Get the Expos!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Best dry erase markers I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I love these! My husband and I use these on our goals/to-do board and love the color, glide, and how easy it is to clean. They seriously make me want to use dry erase boards more often. The smell isn't even overwhelming! Wooohoo! I recommend these for sure.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieJoy

customer_reviews.title: Best on standard marker board, not great for glass.
customer_reviews.text: I was not impressed at all when I used them on my GLASS marker board. The colors are very light, and not bright at all. So I tested them on a standard white marker board. On the standard board the colors were bright and bold. So if you are buying for a glass Marker board, I wouldn’t buy them, but a standard marker board for sure!!
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Young

customer_reviews.title: Issues with these dry erase markers
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these Quartet pens for our Quartet glass/magnetic boards around the office. In the first couple of weeks, they were great. Bright/brilliant color; however, begain drying out very easily. Most have not lasted 3 months (each have been capped and have not been used very much at all). I tried shaking them and keeping them in a downard position; but, one by one they are drying up and not writing on the glass boards (from this same company).
customer_reviews.author: Administrative Supervisor

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Out of the entire box, 3 markers actually wrote in what could pass for black ink. I was trying to save money since I'm a teacher and buying things like office supplies can add up quickly. I'm throwing 9 of the markers out because they look like my Expo markers when they're about to run out of ink. I will never purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: miguel vivas

customer_reviews.title: There alright
customer_reviews.text: Some of the markers leaked when I used them. As I was walking the ink would drip from the pen and I found drops of ink on classroom floor. Very messy.
customer_reviews.author: Tony L. Neader

customer_reviews.title: Great on Dry erase boards.
customer_reviews.text: We have dry erase boards, glass boards, and chalk sidewalk boards. These work great on the dry erase, and the white glass boards. Have a black glass board and these will not show up on it. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: TLBrooks

customer_reviews.title: Sharp colors and firm chisel tip
customer_reviews.text: We're using these on glass Quartet calendar whiteboards. The lines are really crisp and the colors are solid (not watered down or streaky). So far, they seem to cap easily and all arrived with usable ink. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: HHH

customer_reviews.title: Markers don't lay down a solid line.
customer_reviews.text: These markers are worthless. I'm trying to use them on a calendar. The might be bold colors but they are not solid colors. They are translucent. Very difficult to read, unless I only use black.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great markers for the white board
customer_reviews.text: I'm the type who can't express a complex idea without the help of a white board, and so I go through a lot of markers. Out of all the ones I've tried, the Quartet's are generally my favorite...the tip is wide - but not too wide - and they erase easily without being as strong smelling as other brands. The colors are vibrant and readable, and they tend to last quite a long time, even if you leave the cap off the way I sometimes do. They work especially well on our glass marker boards, where they erase without a trace. Definitely worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Executive

customer_reviews.title: The best marker for glass whiteboards, period.
customer_reviews.text: I have a love/hate relationship with clear or lightly frosted glass whiteboards. They look terrific, they are easy to erase, they last forever, and they never stain. Glass whiteboards are also the hardest to see the marker on them. Most markers barely leave enough contrast to read what you have just written when the marker is new, and are totally unusable when they dry out. This Quartet marker though is way better than any other marker for glass. The black is always bold and stays that way. The best marker for glass whiteboards as well as any other whiteboard out there.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Pombrio

customer_reviews.title: I think there are better products out there that might actually show up
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to go with my glass dry erase board. Most of the colors are faint and hard to see. I think there are better products out there that might actually show up. That said, the black works great.
customer_reviews.author: L. deHart

customer_reviews.title: The best i have used, just wish they last a bit longer for that price
customer_reviews.text: A little bit more expensive than others but all worth it for the quality. 1. easy to write on the board 2. easy to wipe off from the board 3. very consistent output to the very end
customer_reviews.author: Jay Yu

customer_reviews.title: Image and title misleading!
customer_reviews.text: Although these are great markers, the image and title is very misleading. I thought I was going to be getting the ASSORTED COLORS as shown in the image and description; however, I just received red, black, blue, and green. When I went back to the page it does say this in the last part of the description, but it should clearly has this in the image and title as I have already purchased this brand before and did not need to read description. BOLD assorted colors does not fit black, red, dark blue, and dark green.
customer_reviews.author: Mbarnas

customer_reviews.title: Best ever teacher marker!
customer_reviews.text: As a teacher, I am extremely picky about my white board markers. These leave no odor at all. The liquid smoothly glides on the board. The only colors that can be harder to erase are the red, orange and pink. I purchased two packages of these markers and they lasted me all but three weeks of school. I write on my board a ton!!!
customer_reviews.author: hrays477

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.text: I just opened the package and tested the markers the colors show up nice and bold like they say they do so far I really like them. I have a picture showing the colors and a picture of them being erased. Great product so far.
customer_reviews.author: erin Hildreth

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Buy it
customer_reviews.text: These came in like 14 hours after I ordered them so kudos on shipping speed! Quality is fantastic and would highly recommend this brand. I ordered a 8' x 4' White board and it came with a single black quartet marker. Up until now I've been using expo. After I used Quartet I immediately came to Amazon and found a large variety pack. Buy it, you'll be glad you did!
customer_reviews.author: Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Glad I went with the chisel tip
customer_reviews.text: Since I went with a Quartet board I decided to go with the Quartet accessories also. These come in at least two tip styles. I'm glad I went with the chisel tip. Great color selection. Love the see-thru ink level indicator.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Just keep on going strong!
customer_reviews.text: Love the window that lets you see how much ink is left, that really helps. These go a very long time, MUCH longer than any other marker I have used. No problems at all after a year of use!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Nice bold markers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and some by Arteza. These ones are so much better. The colors are nice and bold and it erases very cleanly. I haven’t had them for long, so I can’t comment on their longevity. But, I definitely recommend these over Arteza or Expo.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Bamper

customer_reviews.title: Bold Markers
customer_reviews.text: Excellent white erase markers! The ink is bold on the white board and easy to erase. It's nice to see the ink level on the barrel. They are much better than the Expo brand.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Andrae

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Good purchase for the money. Decent lifespan. Doesn't mark as boldly as Expo dry erase markers, instead comes out more of a 'liquidy' mark.
customer_reviews.author: jason sparks

customer_reviews.title: Different tips create versatility
customer_reviews.text: Colors are vibrant and I love the different tips quartet makes. I use them at home on our family whiteboard, and at school when I’m working with my peers in study groups.
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: They Are Markers. Good Job
customer_reviews.text: They do what they're supposed to do without many issues. No leaking or quick drying. And there are so many that come in a pack. 8/10
customer_reviews.author: Shanners

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, worse than my possible worst case scenario.
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as bold color, in reality you can barely see them. They are very watery, hard to read even for the writer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Will cause fights with office mates
customer_reviews.text: These are by far and away the boldest and best white board markers I have ever used. Since the ones are company supplied were comically bad, people were always "borrowing" these. I felt like a drug dealer, "Hey man..... got any blue markers today?". We ended up getting our supply guy to switch over to these so now everyone has them.
customer_reviews.author: azwildcat

customer_reviews.title: Great markers!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a teacher and I use dry erase markers constantly. These are so much better than the Expo markers I was using. Unlike those, these last a long time and the color payoff is much better. My students love all the colors I use and it helps draw their attention to the board and the different colors help with following along on the board. I also find these easier to write with and they're less prone to drying up. I'm going to continue to use this brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: S.O.

customer_reviews.title: Great markers!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a teacher and I use dry erase markers constantly. These are so much better than the Expo markers I was using. Unlike those, these last a long time and the color payoff is much better. I also find these easier to write with and they're less prone to drying up. I'm going to continue to use this brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: S.O.

customer_reviews.title: Vivid colors and they work on glass and whiteboards
customer_reviews.text: This markers are great for white boards and glass. The colors are vivid and they provide high contrast. The quality of the product is in line with the price and expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Great, but beware, kids love these TOO much
customer_reviews.text: ONLY MARKERS I USE! My students like them a little too much, though. They just write SO well that the kids are tempted to use them in order to draw all over the board. That wastes the ink rather quickly. Other than that, this product is a goldmine.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Carver

customer_reviews.title: Last a long time!
customer_reviews.text: We use these every day as part of our homeschool. They are high quality and show no signs of drying out any time soon! I am very pleased, because I often find myself replacing dry erase markers every couple months. These are still writing as perfectly as the day they came out of the box! Finally a marker I can count on.
customer_reviews.author: Chantal M.

customer_reviews.title: More info after Christmas
customer_reviews.text: This is part of the Quartet glass white board gift I purchased for my nephew. It shipped to my parents' home but I will update after Christmas. We use Quartet products at work so I don't doubt the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna H

customer_reviews.title: Best dry erase markers around
customer_reviews.text: These are the best dry erase markers around. The ink is bright and thick and easy to control, and they don't dry out. My only quibble is that they don't have as much ink as you think they do, so you have to buy more fairly regularly. Totally worth it though.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Only Markers I Use Now!
customer_reviews.text: I specifically buy these on here for the best price. I wont use any other whiteboard markers. These are outstanding, they show up, they wipe off easy, don't smear, they even have a gauge on the side to show how much ink is left before each maker stops working. I would highly recommend. (Side note: I do not use bright colors such as lime green as I am colorblind and like to avoid frustration, however, friends of mine who borrow my markers have said some of the lighter colors are harder to see)
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Wait for it to dry first, then erase. That's how Dry Erase works.
customer_reviews.text: They work great on my, but to be honest many of the colors are VERY close to each other (e.g. the reds and blues). One or two are a little too light for office use. I'd say you really have about six different, usable colors. But they get the job done at the end of the day, and using Quartet Markers on the Quartet Board is a good match.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Dried before I used it
customer_reviews.text: So I bought these and use them every now and then. I've had them for a few months and went to use the red one only to find out it is already dried out. Never even opened it. DO NOT BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.author: dbhouston

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: Use these markers at least twice a week for large group and classroom instruction. You can actually SEE WHAT IS WRITTEN on the board from all over the room.
customer_reviews.author: OHaze

customer_reviews.title: Great color, best dry erase markers ever!
customer_reviews.text: The best dry erase markers that I’ve ever used! Vivid colors and still going strong after several months and lots of use. I homeschool and my kids are using dry erase markers every day, they love these ones. I highly recommended these markers...buy them with confidence! So much better than anything I’ve purchased at Walmart or staples.
customer_reviews.author: lb

customer_reviews.title: Every color works great (except orange)
customer_reviews.text: There were 12 markers in the package, every marker worked great with my board except the orange one, will probably throw it out as it left orange hue on the board after erasing it. Other colors worked fine and were easy to remove, without any traces.
customer_reviews.author: Shushan Arakelyan

customer_reviews.title: Because I homeschool I’ve tried them all...These are the best.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried, different kinds of Expo markers and UBrand and these are by far my favorite. They go on true to color, vibrant and erase easily. I’ve been using them regularly and the color is lasting.
customer_reviews.author: laexception

customer_reviews.title: Good deal!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I've only had them a short time, & have used them almost daily. Ink is well saturated with color.
customer_reviews.author: C.S.

customer_reviews.title: Wider than picture makes them appear
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand but usually use the thinner ones. I bought these because they were a great price. Besides being thicker than I imagined they're great. They don't dry out and you can see how much ink is left.
customer_reviews.author: Erica D.

customer_reviews.title: Good markers
customer_reviews.text: These are good markers for dry erase boards. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Pinupgirl

customer_reviews.title: Not very vibrant
customer_reviews.text: I just received these so can't speak to the longevity, but the colors overall are not very vibrant on my frosted glass whiteboard. They also write unevenly. I like the colors but overall would say the quality is OK at best.
customer_reviews.author: Nushin Alloo

customer_reviews.title: Great for writing on glass
customer_reviews.text: Finally convinced my boss to buy these for us and he's in love with them screw all the other dry erase markers these are God
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: A bad batch?
customer_reviews.text: These are normally great markers. I ordered in December, but by May the whole set was half dry, despite being stored in a cool room with lids capped.
customer_reviews.author: kdelo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Very smooth on the board, very vibrant clear colors, they don't dry up like the Expo markers we have lying around the office. We've all been there, you are trying to make a point on the whiteboard and your marker keeps failing you and you have to stop and interrupt your train of thought. I got frustrated and got these and I'm glad I did. They are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad Baitalmal

customer_reviews.title: Best dry erase markers on the planet.
customer_reviews.text: Best dry erase markers on the planet. I love dry erase boards and have them at work and at home. These are by far the best markers out there. No need to look anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: DWeb

customer_reviews.title: Not as Bright as they should be and Don't last long
customer_reviews.text: I love the glass whiteboard. These markers were recommended and I bought a full set. They are not as bright as they should be for good viewing and they don't last long at all. Disappointed ...I will find another brand.
customer_reviews.author: John Dewees

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC pens
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time on other whiteboard pens. These are INCREDIBLE. I will never buy any others. The flow is excellent, the ink is bold and absolutely visible and readable across a room. I use them all the time for classes with as many as 50 students and haven't had ANY dry out. I'm just sorry I didn't discover these years ago so I could have saved my $$ on those useless EXPO markers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not the greatest
customer_reviews.text: not the darkest, or clearest, turns into a chalk like line, that is difficult to erase even with an eraser for the glass. always leaves specks and streaks. the packaging is so much nicer than the ink.
customer_reviews.author: Jello

customer_reviews.title: High contrast colors!
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the ones that came with the white board. The colored cap holder on the back did pull out but did not leak as others had experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: These are excellent!! I have a Quartet Dry Erase board ...
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent!! I have a Quartet Dry Erase board and I've always used the EXPO markers. These are much easier to erase and so my board stays much cleaner now. The colors are vibrant and make homeschooling more fun. :)
customer_reviews.author: JE

customer_reviews.title: Best dry erase markers there are.
customer_reviews.text: If they made a fine point of these markers I would buy them, they write, view and clean the easiest of any marker I've tried...for about the same price!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Solar

customer_reviews.title: do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Color is weak compared to other brands, do not waste your money, bought these for my glass board and they seem very faded.
customer_reviews.author: AST

customer_reviews.title: The best dry erase markers you'll find.
customer_reviews.text: These are the markers I request every single time I have a need for dry erase pens. SO MUCH better than the expo ones, colors are more vibrant, last much longer, and there's no mystery when they do run low. Takes a min to get used to the fact that you can't erase something cleanly just after you write it but that's the price you pay for a darker more vibrant mark.
customer_reviews.author: Tony S

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely lovely way to go...
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these smooth flowing markers! No issues, no excessive bleeding, not a cause for ghosting, yada yada yada. Just an excellent product. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Markers!
customer_reviews.text: If you want your markers to last, buy this brand! The color is amazing and bold.
customer_reviews.author: MamaBear35

customer_reviews.title: The best dry erase markers!
customer_reviews.text: I have used at least two or three of the big brand dry erase markers and they all have disappointed me until now. These markers have a little window into the ink reservoir, they seem to last longer than the rest, the nibs are high quality and I love the colors. I've already restocked for next year.
customer_reviews.author: Javamama

customer_reviews.title: Nice markers
customer_reviews.text: hard to see a few of the colors on a white board
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Stoxen

customer_reviews.title: Great Colors
customer_reviews.text: It was delivered quickly. Product is as stated. I don't know about longevity as I have not had them long enough but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: BEM

product_meta.title: Quartet Dry Erase Markers, Whiteboard Markers, Chisel Tip, EnduraGlide, Assorted Colors, White Board Dry Erase Pens for Teachers, Home School & Office Supplies, Bold Color, 12 Pack (5001-20MA)
product_meta.description: Color:Assorted - Classic Plus| Size:12 PackQuartet EnduraGlide Dry-Erase Markers deliver strong bold color every time, to ensure that your message is distinct and legible. Clearly display your writing with our patented 3-chamber, liquid ink system. Plus, our see-through ink gauge shows exactly how much ink remains for your use. Simply look at the barrel to determine when it’s time to change your marker. Quickly move from one project to the next with these easy to erase markers. Don’t fuss with caked on ink. The smooth ink easily wipes away, leaving a streak-free, clean surface. You can create either thick or thin lines with the versatile chisel tip. The multipurpose point allows you to customize your written message to fit your needs. Pack contains 12 assorted colors, including Lime Green, Orange, Purple, Neon Blue, Pink, Green, Red, Blue and Black. The non-toxic, low odor ink is perfect for any environment, such as classrooms, offices and homes.
feature_bullets: BOLD COLOR: Clearly display your writing with our patented 3 chamber, liquid ink system. Delivers strong bold color every time, to ensure that your message is distinct and legible
TRANSPARENT INK GAUGE: Our see through ink gauge shows exactly how much ink remains for your use. Simply look at the barrel to determine when it’s time to change your marker
EASY TO ERASE: Quickly move from one project to the next with these easy to erase markers. Don’t fuss with caked on ink. The smooth ink easily wipes away, leaving a streak free, clean surface
VERSATILE CHISEL TIP: Create either thick or thin lines with the versatile chisel tip. The multipurpose point allows you to customize your written message to fit your needs
COLOR VARIETY: Pack contains 12 assorted colors, including Lime Green, Orange, Purple, Neon Blue, Pink, Green, Red, Blue and Black
LOW ODOR: Keep your room clean and odor free. The non toxic, low odor ink is perfect for any environment, such as classrooms, offices and homes
